title: Storage Analytics and Simulation Engineer
summary: At Apple, you'll accomplish truly extraordinary things. Our group is building the state of the art, fastest and most efficient SSD, used on the iPhone, the iPad, Apple Watch and the new Apple Silicon Macs. If you are an experienced software engineer, with a passion for real time systems, embedded storage solutions and simulations, have excellent attention to detail, and are dedicated to improving customer experience, please join us! The Storage Simulation team builds our SSD simulator which runs firmware, analyzes and produces insights, and profiles realistic workloads over many thousands of cores. We are a high-pace and high-functioning team of FW engineers, Backend engineers and Data Scientists that use the latest simulation technologies to tackle complex, large-scale problems. We work collaboratively to make impact that changes people's lives.
description: As a key member of our team, you will lead the design and development of our advanced storage simulation, enhancing its integration with the storage subsystem. You will utilize state-of-the-art cloud computing, sophisticated data analytics, and powerful visualization tools to advance our SSD technologies. Collaborating with the SSD firmware team, backend team, and the drivers and applications teams, you will tackle time-critical, complex challenges. Your efforts will transform complex data into actionable insights, significantly boosting the efficiency and performance of Apple’s storage solutions.
preferred_qualifications: Masters/Phd in Computer Engineering/Computer Science/Physic/Mathematics or equivalent experience/skills, Solid understanding of SSD software architecture and FW (e.g. NAND flash commands and media management algorithms), Experience programming in Python in a professional setting, Experience with applying cloud processing technologies (e.g. Kubernetes, AWS ), Experience with data processing and visualization tools, Highly organized, creative, motivated, and passionate about achieving results, Curious and have excellent analytical and problem solving skills
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $143,100 and $264,200, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.
